bestBHT.bht: In those days, after the tribulation, there will be astounding events that may astonish even the best prepared. The sun will be darkened, and the moon will not give her light, as described by the prophets. However, these apocalyptic symbols are not meant to be taken literally. Peter even applied a similar prophecy to the events on the day of Pentecost. The length of the interval between these events is unclear, as it is not definitively indicated.

Henry Alford: Though I have forewarned you of all things, yet some of those shall be so terrible as to astound even the best prepared among you.
In those days, after that tribulation—then those days come after that tribulation.
Our Evangelist omits the mourning of the tribes of the earth, and the seeing the sign of the Son of Man.
Jamieson-Fausset-Brown: 24. But in those days, after that
tribulation—"Immediately after the tribulation of those
and the moon shall not give her light.
Marvin Vincent: Light [φεγγος] . The word is used in the New Testament wherever the light of the moon is referred to.
Compare Matthew 24:29, the only other instance.
It occurs also in Luke 11:33, but meaning the light - of a lamp.
Philip Schaff: But. Here almost equivalent to ‘nevertheless;’ although I have foretold you all things, yet the subsequent tribulations may still astonish you.
After that tribulation. The length of the interval is not definitely indicated.
And the stars shall be falling. This vivid form is peculiar to Mark.
Archibald T. Robertson: These figures come from the prophets... One should not forget that prophetic imagery was not always meant to be taken literally, especially apocalyptic symbols." (Commentary)
Peter in Acts 2:15-21 applies the prophecy of Joel about the sun and moon to the events on the day of Pentecost." (Commentary)
See on Matthew 24:29-31 for details of verses Mark 13:24-27." (Commentary)
John Gill: After the destruction of the city and temple of Jerusalem, and the miseries and calamities attending it...
The sun shall be darkened... and the moon shall not give her light...
The ceremonial law, which though abolished by the death of Christ, was observed by the Jews as long as the temple stood; but now ceased.
John Wesley: But in those days — Which immediately precede the end of the world: after that tribulation - Above described.

bhtAttempts.bht: In those days, after the tribulation, there will be astounding and terrible events that even the best prepared among you may find astonishing. The sun will be darkened, and the moon will not give her light. These figures come from the prophets and should not be taken literally, as prophetic imagery often uses apocalyptic symbols. Peter even applied a similar prophecy to the events on the day of Pentecost. It is important to note that the length of the interval between these events is not indicated.

It is important to note that the length of the interval between these events is not indicated.
